tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes for a new sitting fortnight. Coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Sophie Thomson explores the origins of Adelaides free food carts; Costa Georgiadis meets fresh food fan Dr Sandro Demaio from ABCs Ask The Doctor, and Josh Byrne visits the Perth garden of author Deryn Thorpe.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Private donors are paying for the White House ballroom and even the US military. Who are they and what do they get in return? And is it legal? Plus the shutdown threatens food stamps and the "hostile act" of a Canadian TV ad.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week continues with coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The most extraordinary search we have ever undertaken. Alley Lofthouse was left on a doorstep in a block of flats in Scotland on a cold February night. Will she ever resolve the mystery of her abandonment? (Final)

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: End Game with Tony Armstrong
programme.desc: Tony investigates how athlete activism can combat racism in sport, questioning why Australia often resists outspoken athletes like Adam Goodes.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Despite government promises of reform, Adele Ferguson uncovers more than 100 cases of alleged paedophiles who worked or are working in child care, enabled by systemic failures, weak oversight and a profit-driven industry.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week continues with coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team of experts return for a second visit to Hopetoun House in Queensferry, Scotland, where the finds include Victorian dresses worn by royalty and a 16th century silver jewel box.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Albos Trump success was a surprise for those who anticipated failure. An electronics company doing under the table deals with online reviewers. A Swisse supplement story revealed to be a mea culpa to an unhappy advertiser.

programme.title: Julia Zemiros Home Delivery
programme.desc: Dave Faulkner, lead singer and songwriter of much-loved band the Hoodoo Gurus, goes back to Western Australia to show Julia some of the pivotal locations of his childhood, and chat about his musical beginnings.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two ground-breaking cases for Long Lost Family: an overseas adoption from Ecuador and a complex search using DNA analysis.

In an Australian exclusive, former US Vice President Kamala Harris sits down with Sarah Ferguson to reveal behind the scenes of the shortest and most consequential Presidential campaign in modern history, and where to now.

programme.title: Mother And Son
programme.desc: Terrified that her memory is failing her, Maggie decides to throw a "70th Birthday to remember" and unwittingly drags Arthur and Robbie into a chaos theyd soon wish to forget. (Final)

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Are you squeamish? Find out why in todays lab experiment and get ready to get moving in Investigation Ouch! The Doctors tackle medical mysteries on the wards in Ouch and About and we meet two more new Ouch Patients.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Ranger Tabes tells the Bears shes been investigating a mysterious creature. But when the Bears realise shes actually investigating their friend Charlie, they split up to ensure Charlies safety.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Soccer Saga
programme.desc: Kyle asks Maudie and Ava to make a video of his soccer match but Maudie discovers something about the game is not quite right.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi discover a long lost ship.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When Shaun accidentally breaks the Farmers glasses, he and Bitzer have their work cut out trying to prevent their short-sighted master from having mishaps around the farm.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors test how strong your stomach acid really is. And will it be Dr Chris, Dr Xand or Dr Ronx who gets snotted in Ouchology?

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: For the first time ever Steve travels to Gabon. Exploring Loango National Park Steve goes in search of crocodiles, surprisingly deadly chimpanzees and feisty forest elephants.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors see how much pain they can take in their laboratory, Dr Xand investigates how our shoes can dramatically change the way we walk and Dr Chris goes on call with an emergency ambulance team.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand has created a thunder tube to show you how your vocal tract makes your voice loud, meet Brilliant Body Anoushe Husain as she takes Dr Ronx climbing, and find out whos todays Top Doc in our Ouchology quiz.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Hap teams up with the Jedi to rescue his friends

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer gives Bitzer a horrible new hat. Bitzer is very upset as he treasured his old hat. The flock rally round to try and cheer him up with a selection of dashing alternative head-gear.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The smell of Dr Xands pongy feet takes over the lab, so the doctors investigate. Dr Dan and Dr Raph work their quads with Gladiator Dynamite. And find out where your ginglymus is.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven thinks his favorite ice cream sandwiches are the trick to summoning his magic shield but learns otherwise when facing off with an acid-spewing insect monster.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: After the bears play a little pickup basketball, they go back to grab their stuff by the side of the court only to find its been stolen!

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Jessicas decision to rent out the flip house instead of selling it backfires on her, Honey and Grandma. Meanwhile, amateur detectives Emery and Evan take on the mystery of Louis missing watch.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: "Goodbye ageing obscurity and Hello! magazine", Patsys got a week to look 35 for the photos - cue a trip to hospital for a face peel and eye rejuvenation.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors reveal how far your heart can pump blood and Dr Xand meets a life-saving dog. Over in Accidents and Emergency one patients face is swollen with a dental abscess and another has sliced her finger.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Fontaines amazed when Smiling Finn calls her and tells her hes detected a signal from her grandparents missing submarine. Is this a joke - an elaborate scam or something even more amazing?

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: The Bears work as short-order cooks in a giants diner.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Robin, Cyborg, and Beast Boy get trapped in an elevator.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: The quarterfinal battle between Ash and Paul is building to a fever pitch, and with it, some surprising revelations between them!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners plant a pizza shaped herb garden to create the ultimate pizzas!

programme.title: BTN
programme.desc: Critical Minerals; Louvre Heist; Deep Time; Hand Washing; Young Surfer

programme.title: Volcanoes
programme.desc: Explore the world of volcanoes, their formation and types, and the dangers and benefits they bring to us. Plus the different economic and social reasons that entice people to continue living near them.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Cheshire and Lancashire are in Phils sights today as he goes undercover, trying to secure offers on two houses.

programme.title: Austin
programme.desc: Austin bombs his press conference and book signing, Mels romance is vetted by the government, and Julians secret identity as a young queer bee-saving writer is exposed.

programme.title: rage Alt Hip Hop Special
programme.desc: From Paris Texas to JPEGFMAFIA, Brockhampton, Death Grips, Lil Simz and more, rage plays the best alt hip hop clips from the collection.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors reveal what comes out of your mouth when you cough, Dr Xand gets a front row seat at a life-changing operation and there ARE more intriguing medical mysteries to solve in Ouch and About.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A submarine is trapped in an astonishing location! The Nektons launch an elaborate and dangerous rescue mission to save the people inside. Could it be their missing grandparents?

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: When the box goes missing at a haunted mansion, the Bears play detective to help uncover the thief.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: After Robin swipes her cloak, Ravens leggy figure is revealed.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: In the Sinnoh League semifinals, Ash faces Tobias, a Trainer hes heard a lot about during the competition - because Tobias has the incredibly powerful Mythical Pokemon Darkrai on his team!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When Orla breaks up the band Soundcheck, the Mobile Unit team must convince the band members to reunite. On top of that, the Mobile Unit must make sure a villainous rival band doesnt hypnotise people with their music.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors find out what fear does to your body with a supersized balloon pop, and find out what makes our Ouch Babies laugh!

programme.title: Show Me The Honey!
programme.desc: The five wanna-bee keepers continue their honey making journey and compete for a coveted Golden Honeybee in the Bee BandB challenge.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: From the grand hills of Edinburgh to the shores of the North Ayrshire coast, Phils two Scottish locations this week couldnt be more different.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: John, a tailor from London, dreams of creating his own office space in the garden so he can spend more time closer to home after the arrival of a newborn baby.

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: The team discover Gerrys nationalist views, his connections to the suspects, and his violent streak. Jess reaches out to her sister, as Leanne and Sunnys friendship evolves.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Carol worries about a Russian girl with AIDS who is brought in and then abandoned by her foster mother. Kayson asks Susan to be his Valentine. Deb accidentally consumes LSD-laced chocolates.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, all the friends are reading books together and thinking of their favourite stories. Colly Wobbles favourite story is all about a Horsey in the House silly song! Who can resist joining in?

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Beep and Mort accidentally shred the only story book in Mollyvale. Ooops! When they try to recreate the story from everyones memories, they find theres more than one hero in the village and plenty of stories to share.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Jango dresses up as a king and his friends mistake him for a king visiting Hoopla, so Jango decides to trick them into preparing a King sized feast.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector gets help from a friend when he finds trees that have been cut down.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him superfast. Bing quickly learns that a little dizzy is fun, but too much dizzy is no fun at all.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle takes Peppa and her school friends on a school bus trip to the mountains. From the top of the mountains there is a fantastic view and Peppa and her friends have fun hearing echoes.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Theres a new kid on the block and hes up to no good. At first Bitzer is charmed by the newcomer, but when he starts to get him into trouble, Shaun decides something must be done to teach him a lesson.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compassand soon without a map, either!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Twins really want a pet, so Nanny Plum sets out to get them one. She magics them up Pippin the hamster. The Wise Old Elf brings Pippin a hamster wheel, but Pippin runs too fast in it and breaks out of the castle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George have a lovely day in the park with Mummy and Daddy learning how to throw and catch the flying discs.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Frizzys dad gets into trouble in the mountains, Frizzy steps up to lead the rescue mission and save the day!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters celebrate Monster Heart-Friend Night with teamwork, creativity, and heartfelt gestures to make everyone feel special.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Superstar Papaya
programme.desc: Jay is totally taken with a green papaya that Appa grew for a sambar dinner/recipe. Will they be able to find it when it goes missing?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector hears a roar from the Wildlife Park that is bigger than the lions!

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: What is a cyclone? Weather reporter Nate Byrne and Miah learn all about wonderful weather and see if they can create a swirling and whirling cyclone in a bottle.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Lucia and Simon are in the Wiggly Kitchen and come across an egg. Sing along to a nursery rhyme favourite Humpty Dumpty. Now Simon and Lucia have three cracked eggs and they cant waste them, what to do?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Jump up and join in with the Alphablocks clapping song! This episode introduces starting blends and the words top, stop, pot, spot, lap, clap, slap, flap, skip, slip, flip, ram and tram.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Goldie the Goldfish is feeling a little lonely, so Peppa takes her to the aquarium. With all the different fish surely Peppa can find a new friend for Goldie?

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie realizes she could use another maker space at Dads house, she and Dad set out to build their very own treehouse.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When noisy swans threaten to disrupt Carlos and Drews band performance, the Dream Factory Crew have to find a clever way to lead them away.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Giant Jelly
programme.desc: The Octonauts must rescue Peso when he gets trapped inside a giant Comb Jelly!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels have a dance off with Chippo and the Rock Slippy Crew.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Thomas meets another big blue engine in Brazil that reminds him of Gordon.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Millie and the kids learn about wicking gardens and how veggies love them. They create their own wicking gardens with herbs.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles for a journey to outer space with their Wiggly friends, Buddy and Tree of Wisdom! Its a learning adventure thats out of this world!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters learn to care for Glorb responsibly when overfeeding him turns their small ham-monster into a gigantic problem, teaching teamwork and balance.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig is left behind when everyone takes Grampy Rabbits little boat to the riverside picnic spot. Will someone remember him and save him some cake?

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Lunagirl discovers that if you really cant share something, then you might lose it completely.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington, Jonathan and Judy are worried theyve used up all of Lucky the dogs luck - how will they tell Sofia?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Granny Thistle comes to visit and gives Daisy and Poppy a powerful magical wand. The children escape from the castle and...go bananas!

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Rocket Club are excited to visit Planet Oceania, but their voyage of discovery takes an unexpected turn when Ravi becomes obsessed with his hi-tech underwater speeder!

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Dibillo decides to wear his favourite bow tie for the day. Mr Onion is very excited, and takes Dibillo around the house to show everybody how smart he looks.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Beep unwittingly disrupts a fuzzlefly family while gathering specimens. When the fuzzleflies make their new home in her spaceship it sets of a loud alarm, causing mayhem in Mollyvale! How will she fix her home sweet home?

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Jango is determined to be picked to be in the Hoopla Fire Brigade.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector finds new sounds at the stables, and Mole is making new sounds too!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of the sofa cushions and Coco decides its the perfect starting point for a game of Big Bad Wolf with Sula and Charlie. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are going to Rebecca Rabbits house today. Rebeccas house is a bit different; it is inside a hill and has tunnels instead of stairs and corridors. Peppa and George love Rebeccas house.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Game on! Everyone is excitedly getting ready to watch a football match on TV, when an out of control toy plane hits the TV aerial, ruining the picture. Bitzer is sent to fix the problem and asks the Flock for help.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: During a search and rescue drill, Penny and Annies childhood rivalry leads to a river rescue on board Hydrus and Phoenix.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: After seeing a toy Elf rocket, the King orders a real rocket to fly to the moon. Elf honour is at stake and the Elves make a rocket in record time. For the trip, Nanny packs a picnic.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle has invited Mr Potato to lead the playgroup in a fun musical workout for children.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Big Trev tells Pounce and Gemma a tale from his childhood as they wait for his elderly turtle friend, Salty, to arrive.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters spread love and kindness using their superpowers to connect with loved ones far away.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Magic Trick
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay have planned a magic trick for Jims birthday, but Nikhil has a nervous monster in his tummy. Can they perform the best trick of all and make the monster disappear?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector creates a performance of sight and sound for his friends.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can you make a picture drawn with ink move and float? Matt learns how he can get drawings of his fish, Wriggle and Swish, to move and swim about as if real!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Shirley Shawn the Unicorn and Tsehay are in the Wiggly Kitchen, what will they find today? Sing along to the Wiggly favourite Hot Potato then the Wiggle Town Dancing Water Police are here to help!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: H needs a helping hand to heave herself up the hill, so I turns instructor for a workout she wont forget. This episode has fun with letter blends and the words kit, sit, fit, lift, flip, slip and spin.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig is left behind when everyone takes Grampy Rabbits little boat to the riverside picnic spot. Will someone remember him and save him some cake?

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Realizing Mr. Lins shop could use a bit of a refresh, Millie, Ben and Alicia conspire to surprise him with a new paint job.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory - and their Twin-Bots - save the Robotics competition when Biff and Tiffs robots go wild.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Dashi snaps a picture of what appears to be a sea serpent, but the truth is stranger than fiction when it turns out to be an awesomely long Oarfish!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels meet a scruffelump they want to keep as a pet.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Thomas finds a way to take part in the Brazilian carnival music.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: A whole episode dedicated to poo and what it does for the garden. Costa and the kids compare chicken and cow poo and set up an experiment to see what grows best in different poos.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Help The Wiggles get ready for a dance party, by choosing the perfect sound system, getting supplies, and practicing your grooviest dance moves! Then, play along in a game of Musical Statues!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Cleo befriends Griffy, a baby griffin, and overcomes her fear of unfamiliar animals by helping him fly, while the Super Monsters explore magical creatures at the petting zoo.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is night time at Grandpa and Granny Pigs house, Peppa and George have stayed up late to help hunt for slugs and snails. But what other night animals will they find?

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Owlette is teaching Owl lot sof stunts and tricks. But Romeo wants some Owl-y power of his own.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Baaz teaches Jonathan and Paddington about upcycling but can the pair create something to earn a reward.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Rocket Club attempts to rescue a rickety spaceship thats flown dangerously close to the sun.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes for a new sitting fortnight. Coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Record temperatures as extreme weather sets in across parts of the country, going against the guidelines - the rise in popularity of raw milk, plus a burning ball of space junk crashes to earth in the Aussie outback.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump on the world stage meeting with ASEAN leaders including Anthony Albanese in Malaysia, then on to Japan and South Korea. Meanwhile at home the government shutdown, and the East Wing of the White House demolished.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days top stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Despite government promises of reform, Adele Ferguson uncovers more than 100 cases of alleged paedophiles who worked or are working in child care, enabled by systemic failures, weak oversight and a profit-driven industry.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Private donors are paying for the White House ballroom and even the US military. Who are they and what do they get in return? And is it legal? Plus the shutdown threatens food stamps and the "hostile act" of a Canadian TV ad.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Lauren Huxley was given little chance of survival after a brutal attack. Twenty years on, she and her family reflect on her miraculous recovery and the fact her attacker could soon be back on the streets.

In an Australian exclusive, former US Vice President Kamala Harris sits down with Sarah Ferguson to reveal behind the scenes of the shortest and most consequential Presidential campaign in modern history, and where to now.
